meanings.definition: Resembling an oak in appearance or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The sturdy table had an oaklike finish that made it look strong.
meanings.sent2: The old tree in the yard had an oaklike trunk with rough bark.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found an oaklike acorn and pretended it was a tiny treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was oaklike, standing tall against any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The ancient door had an oaklike color, reminding him of the forest.

meanings.definition: Having qualities similar to those of an oak tree.
meanings.sent1: The oaklike branches swayed gently in the breeze, mimicking the tree's grace.
meanings.sent2: His deep voice had an oaklike resonance that filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics were oaklike, climbing and leaping with agility.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom was oaklike, rooted in experience and strength.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood tall and oaklike against the horizon, unmoving and majestic.
